Background.data_info: For those with wheather condition being high (A=1), the probability of market demand being high (C=1) is 0.1260. The probability of wheather condition being low (A=0) and market demand being low (C=0) is 0.2732. The probability of wheather condition being high (A=1) and market demand being high (C=1) is 0.0657.

Questions.Instruction: Consider the probability of sufficiency (PS) of wheather condition on market demand.
Questions.Question: Given that wheather condition was low and market demand was low, what is the upper bound of the probability that market demand would have been high if the wheather condition had been high?

Reason.Step 1:
Calculate P(C=1|do(A=1))
P(C=1|do(A=1))=P(C=1|A=1)=0.1260
